content.question: Which of the following is likely to result in allocative inefficiency?

choices.label: A firm producing at the level of output where price is equal to marginal cost
A perfectly competitive market in long-run equilibrium with no externalities
A monopsonist that faces a minimum wage where marginal revenue product equals the supply of labor
